title: Updated Firefox. Now Youtube won't load!
content: I updated Firefox to 95.0.2 . Now Youtube won't load and I get the Security Failed error page with code"PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR" . However, Youtube loads fine in my other browsers. Why is this happening?

title: Strange activity on my account - phone wrongly recognised
content:
I have had a strange thing happening : - on my account, it stated a connexion from a OnePlus A6003 yesterday - I do not have such a phone, I do have however a OnePlus GM1913 - When I disconnected the A6003, it did kick me out of GM1913 - When I reconnected the GM1913, it listed it correctly

What could be the cause of this?
creator: virgil5

title: SVG linearGradient doesn`t work in mozila firefox
content:
This is my SVG:

<svg viewBox="0 0 1226 340" id="back-rainbow" preserveAspectRatio="none"> 

  <defs>      <linearGradient x1="100%" y1="0%" x2="0%" y2="15%" id="back-rainbow-gradient">          <stop stop-color="#8DC6D8" offset="12%"/>          <stop stop-color="#CE97DF" offset="40%"/>          <stop stop-color="#FFCF9F" offset="90%"/>      </linearGradient>   </defs>   <path d="M1074 0C673.94.2 303.56 126 0 340h1226V6c-50.1-3.72-100.95-5.8-152-6z"        fill="url(#back-rainbow-gradient)" />

</svg>

It works in chrome but the problem is in firefox. My SVG doesn`t have color in firefox !!
creator: round1extra

title: (JavaScript) Enter keypress does not work in Mozila FireFox when dropdown control has ListSearchExtender
content:
any one help me to solve my problem...

my page has munber of control... when page is loaded .one of conlrol is Focus().. when i Enter, the next control is Focus.. The Problem is DropDownlist has ListSearchExtender.. so when i enter, the next focus does not work in Mozila Firfox ... Its good working in IE..But not Mozi`la Firefox .. Here my code Below...

function GotoNextFocus(ControlName, e) { 

         var unicode = e.keyCode ? e.keyCode : e.charCode;          var BrowserVersion = parseInt(navigator.appVersion);                        if (unicode == 13) {              var control = document.getElementById(ControlName);              if (control != null) {                  control.focus();                  if (navigator.appName == "Mozilla"|| navigator.appName == "Netscape") {                      e.preventDefault();                                           }                                       else {                                          if(BrowserVersion>=5) {                         e.preventDefault();                        }                        else{                        e.returnValue = false;                        }                                             }                            }          }      }
creator: revolveextra

title: CSS Transition not working in only Mozila firefox browser
content:
Trying to fix this CSS3 Transition for Mozila firefox, it's working perfectly in Chrome and Opera but not working in Mozila firefox 35.0.1+ . I have also applied -moz-keyframes on CSS.

CSS:

/******************

  • Bounce in Left *
                                      • /

@-webkit-keyframes bounceInLeft { 

   0% {        opacity: 0;        -webkit-transform: translateX(-1000px);    } 
   80% {        -webkit-transform: translateX(-10px);    } 
   100% {        -webkit-transform: translateX(0);    }

}

@-moz-keyframes bounceInLeft { 

   0% {        opacity: 0;        -moz-transform: translateX(-1000px);    } 
   80% {        -moz-transform: translateX(-10px);    } 
   100% {        -moz-transform: translateX(0);    }

}

@-o-keyframes bounceInLeft { 

   0% {        opacity: 0;        -o-transform: translateX(-1000px);    } 
   80% {        -o-transform: translateX(-10px);    } 
   100% {        -o-transform: translateX(0);    }

}

@keyframes bounceInLeft { 

   0% {        opacity: 0;        transform: translateX(-1000px);        -moz-transform: translateX(-1000px);    } 
   80% {        transform: translateX(-10px);        -moz-transform: translateX(-10px);    } 
   100% {        transform: translateX(0);        -moz-transform: translateX(0px);    }

}

.animated.bounceInLeft { 

   -webkit-animation-name: bounceInLeft;    -moz-animation-name: bounceInLeft;    -o-animation-name: bounceInLeft;    animation-name: bounceInLeft;

}

/****************

  • bounceInRight *
                                • /

@-webkit-keyframes bounceInRight { 

   0% {        opacity: 0;        -webkit-transform: translateX(1000px);    } 
   80% {        -webkit-transform: translateX(10px);    } 
   100% {        -webkit-transform: translateX(0);    }

}

@-moz-keyframes bounceInRight { 

   0% {        opacity: 0;        -moz-transform: translateX(1000px);    } 
   80% {        -moz-transform: translateX(10px);    } 
   100% {        -moz-transform: translateX(0);    }

}

@-o-keyframes bounceInRight { 

   0% {        opacity: 0;        -o-transform: translateX(1000px);    } 
   80% {        -o-transform: translateX(10px);    } 
   100% {        -o-transform: translateX(0);    }

}

@keyframes bounceInRight { 

   0% {        opacity: 0;        transform: translateX(1000px);    } 
   80% {        transform: translateX(10px);    } 
   100% {        transform: translateX(0);    }

}

.animated.bounceInRight { 

   -webkit-animation-name: bounceInRight;    -moz-animation-name: bounceInRight;    -o-animation-name: bounceInRight;    animation-name: bounceInRight;

}

/* Description */

  1. headslide p {

-webkit-animation-name:bounceInRight; -moz-animation-name:bounceInRight; -o-animation-name:bounceInRight; animation-name:bounceInRight; -webkit-animation-duration:1s; -moz-animation-duration:1s; animation-duration:1s; -moz-animation-fill-mode:both; animation-fill-mode:both; box-shadow:0 1px 4px rgba(0,0,0,0.1); -webkit-box-shadow:0 1px 4px rgba(0,0,0,0.1); -moz-box-shadow:0 1px 4px rgba(0,0,0,0.1); -o-box-shadow:0 1px 4px rgba(0,0,0,0.1); -ms-box-shadow:0 1px 4px rgba(0,0,0,0.1);

margin:0; }

/* Title */

  1. headslide h3 {

-webkit-animation-name:bounceInLeft; -moz-animation-name:bounceInLeft; -o-animation-name:bounceInLeft; animation-name:bounceInLeft; -webkit-animation-duration:1s; -moz-animation-duration:1s; animation-duration:1s; -moz-animation-fill-mode:both; animation-fill-mode:both;

background: #fff; font-size: 110%; line-height: 1.4; padding: 1% 2%; margin: 0; font-weight:normal; text-transform:uppercase; } HTML:

  • <a href="#"></a>

    Description on top.

    <a href="#">Title on bottom</a>

  • <a href="#"></a>

    Description on top.

    <a href="#">Title on bottom</a>

There are two type effects bounceInLeft (Applied on Title on bottom) and bounceInRight (applied on description on top). On Chrome it's working perfectly but not working on Mozila firefox. This Slider has fade transition by default, so it show fade transition on firefox and my bounceInLeft/bounceInRight keyframes works only on Chrome, Opera.

How to fix this?

Please See this Fiddle >> on Mozila firefox 35.0.1+ and on latest Chrome. Thanks.
creator: georgemendellextra

title: How to View Firefox's Update History
content:
While i was browsing through websites using Firefox, i opened a new tab and got the notification saying something like While you were browsing, Firefox was updated in the background. There there was a button at the bottom saying Restart Firefox. When i clicked on that button Firefox restarted automatically as expected. My question is that now i want to see the Update History of Firefox. So how can i check/see the Update history of Firefox.

I am using Ubuntu 18.01 and Firefox 95.0.1 (64bit)
creator: jlame646

title: Firefox Fails to Start After the First Time
content: Firefox will start once (maybe) and then it makes no difference where I click from (tray, programs, desktop shortcut) Firefox refuses to boot up. I've tried re-installing multiple times. If I reboot, it will start. Also sometimes I will get a New tab but the page/URL never comes up. Firefox just hangs. I'm running Windows 11.
creator: r1ch715

title: Crackling sound while playing music
content:
I have recently bought the new macbook pro 16 inch with m1 pro chip. Everytime I play music using firefox, whether it is soundcloud or youtube, and, when I load multiple applications like adobe after effects, illustrator, indesign to work, there is a crackling glitch sound from my speaker. I've tested the same using different browsers but it seems like only firefox is making this issue.

My firefox is updated to the latest version. I've tried removing all the data from my macbook and reinstalled firefox but no luck. It still makes the crackling sound.

Any leads would be really appreciated.
creator: justabjith
